rationale: The comparative 'biggest' modifies 'outbreak', not a risk-adjective of the virus.
statement_text: Czech authorities are preparing to destroy up to 220,000 hens on a poultry farm in the west of the country after bird flu was discovered there last week, in the biggest outbreak to date.

rationale: The phrase 'biggest outbreak to date' uses a superlative + negative noun ('biggest outbreak') to frame the event alarmingly.
statement_text: Czech authorities are preparing to destroy up to 220,000 hens on a poultry farm in the west of the country after bird flu was discovered there last week, in the biggest outbreak to date.
